recap.content:
# Recap
---
Here's a quick recap of our class.

#### Topics Covered
---
Yo what did we learneds?

##### Basics
1. Guts of Network request
2. HTML and CSS basics
100. Pushing webpages to the interwebs

##### Layout and Markup
3. Semantic HTML and how to use
4. CSS3, layouts and grids
11. Frontend Frameworks
10. Positioning!

##### Programming
5. JavaScript basics
6. Functions / Returns
7. Arrays and loops
8. Objects
9. jQuery and events
10. Using web APIs


#### Tools Used
---

1. [Gitbot](http://gitbot.co/)
2. [Live Class Notes](http://autosync.io/#home)
3. [Samantha](http://samantha.fewd.us/)

#### Technologies used
---

1. Semantic UI
2. jQuery
3. Google Maps API
4. jVectorMaps API
5. Firebase API
6. Slick.js

#### Slack #stats
---

##### Total Messages Sent
**5.8k**

##### DMs
**5.2k**: 88% of all messages sent

##### Public Messages
**0.6k**: 11% of all messages sent

letter-of-completion.content:
# Letter of Completion
---

In order to receive a letter of completion, you will need...

#### Requirements
---

* 80% homework completion
* 80% attendance
* Final project submission

#### Next Steps
---

In a few weeks, you'll get an email with a letter that states you've completed this course. This is **not** a certification. Also, in tech **certifications** are effectively meaningless. **BUT**, if your company requires some sort of documentation for reimbursement, this should be valid.

next-steps.content:
# Next Steps --- What's next? #### Perks --- #### [Alumni Perks](https://generalassemb.ly/alumni/perks) #### [GA Events](https://generalassemb.ly/education?format=events) #### [GA NYC Alumni Group](https://www.facebook.com/gnrlassembly/)

#### Learning --- * Keep **practicing**. * Built a badass final project? Cool. Build something else. Learn **[firebase](https://www.firebase.com/)**, **[react](https://facebook.github.io/react/)**, **[node](http://nodeschool.io/).** Most importantly tho: **KEEP. BUILDING. THINGS.** #### Resources --- * [Free Code Camp](https://www.freecodecamp.com/) * [Code Wars](https://www.codewars.com/) #### Community --- I run a personal slack channel for my former students who are actively looking to transition into a software engineering career. Hit me up and I'll add you! Also, you are **all** welcome to audit any future GA Class / Workshop I teach from now til Infinity. **[Check out my page](https://generalassemb.ly/instructors/taq-karim/1667)** for updates on future classes I may teach.

survey.content:
# Survey
---

Please take some time now to fill out your End of Course Surveys! They should be in your email.

Some light music courtesy of DJ Zach will be playing in the background...


#### [G.O.O.D. Musicz](https://play.spotify.com/user/1212575832/playlist/3PXJQfW2Zv878sp02smcfA?play=true&utm_source=open.spotify.com&utm_medium=open)

presentations.content:
# Presentations --- Ok, game time! #### Presentation Guidelines --- 0. Come up to this machine. 1. Click on your project below to open it up. 2. Demo the general gist of your project - click around and show folks what it does and how it works, etc. **Remember**, you've been starting at this for a while, but others haven't - so feel free to point out even the small things your app does. 4. Speak a little bit towards what tech you used, what problems you ran into, etc. Aaaaand now...

#### Presenters --- 1. Charlotte: **[pedestrianwanderlust](https://charlotteashleydaniel.github.io/pedestrianwanderlust/index.html)** 2. Liz: **[Emergen-P](https://elizabethnair.github.io/ToiletFinderFinal/index.html)** 3. Maggie: **[trekcheck](https://maggieadams.github.io/trekcheck/index.html)** 4. Nelly: **[Refugee by Country](https://nellytaheri.github.io/refugeeByCountry/FEWD_Final_Project/)** 5. Nicole: **[ShowDiary](https://nicoleyc19.github.io/showdiary/sign-in.html)** 6. Dave: **[Bro, Do You Even Lift?](https://parsakos.github.io/finalproject/index.html)** Your projects are all awesome. Submit to **[GA Gallery](gallery.generalassemb.ly/)**
